s.text: Merit pay, like alternate certification, is a sound idea that has been blocked by the teachers' unions, which instead want more pay for everybody.

This means that if you're a smart young college graduate or a bored lawyer or a retired-at-42 Army colonel who wants to teach in a public school, you can't do so without obtaining credits in education.

And he needs to prevent his allies in the teachers' unions from continuing to serve as gatekeepers to the profession.
What a poor use of $750 million a year that would be.
